author: Special Correspondent
text:
Contract workers of Chennai Metrowater have decided to withdraw the indefinite strike after the Board agreed to most of their demands.

The Chennai Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board Workers Union had earlier announced a strike beginning from March 15 to protest low wages and long working hours. However, after a round of talks, the Union members withdrew the strike. The Board agreed to provide employment to 382 persons on compassionate grounds and also give long-pending promotions to 30 persons.
title: Metrowater strike withdrawn
